de.tudresden.inf.rn.mobilis.sea.jingle.connection.media

Class RawReceiver

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.tudresden.inf.rn.mobilis.sea.jingle.connection.media.RawReceiver

  • public class RawReceiver
extends java.lang.Object
    The RawReceiver is used to receive Datagrams (UDP). It deserializes the binary input to the original Raw Objects and distributes those items to the registered ReceptionListeners

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.Map<java.lang.Byte,Raw> knownPayloads
      A Map of all payloadTypes which are allowed (those are the communication Objects of type Raw)
      private java.util.Map<java.lang.Byte,ReceptionListener> listeners
      A Map of all registered listeners (this RawReceiver will use those listeners to distribute incoming Raws)
      private boolean opened
      Boolean which declares whether this RawReceiver should receive data
      private java.util.LinkedList<byte[]> packetQueue
      An internal queue to buffer incoming packets (is also used as mutex)
      private boolean receive
      Boolean to determine whether this RawReceiver should should receive packets
      private java.net.DatagramSocket socket
      Socket where to receive datagram packets
      private boolean sorting
      Boolean to determine whether this RawReceiver should sort the incoming packets (default: false)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RawReceiver(java.util.Map<java.lang.Byte,Raw> payloadTypes, java.util.Map<java.lang.Byte,ReceptionListener> listeners, int localPort)
      Constructor for a RawReceiver.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean getSorting()
      Gets the boolean which determines whether this RawReceiver does sort the incoming packets
      void setSorting(boolean sorting)
      Sets whether this RawReceiver should try to sort incoming packets
      void start()
      This method should be invoked directly after this RawReceiver is created => may cause OutOfMemmoryError if not started.
      void stop()
      Stop receiving

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • RawReceiver

        public RawReceiver(java.util.Map<java.lang.Byte,Raw> payloadTypes,
           java.util.Map<java.lang.Byte,ReceptionListener> listeners,
           int localPort)
        Constructor for a RawReceiver. This RawReceiver will instantly listen to the specified port!
        Parameters:
        payloadTypes - Map of all payloadTypes which are allowed (those are the communication Objects of type Raw)
        listeners - Map of all registered listeners (this RawReceiver will use those listeners to distribute incoming Raws)
        localPort - the port on which this RawReceiver should listen

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        This method should be invoked directly after this RawReceiver is created => may cause OutOfMemmoryError if not started. This RawReceiver has to start receiving immediately (due to NAT reasons!)

      • setSorting

        public void setSorting(boolean sorting)
        Sets whether this RawReceiver should try to sort incoming packets
        Parameters:
        sorting - true if the incoming Datagrams should be sorted (otherwise false)

      • getSorting

        public boolean getSorting()
        Gets the boolean which determines whether this RawReceiver does sort the incoming packets
        Returns:
        true if the incoming Datagrams are sorted (otherwise false)

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop receiving
